intro: Nasa poissoniana subsp. glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular nasa, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The subspecies is distinguished by its glandular hairs on the stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. This plant is often found in rocky or alpine habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features.
